sourceMeaningMnemonic: There's a <radical>mouth</radical> in the <radical>ground</radical> (in our case, it's a hatch), and inside is some kind of <radical>prison</radical> you can't quite get to. If you've ever seen Lost, this will sound familiar... on the hatch, there's actually a series of <kanji>number</kanji>s that you don't understand.
meaningInfo: What are these numbers? What do they mean? Think over it for a while, get frustrated, and try to figure it out. You can't, though, so you probably won't ever get inside.
readingMnemonic:
"You want to know the <kanji>number</kanji> to the hatch?" yells an old voice from inside. You say "yes," and the voice gives you the numbers and you're in! You go down into the prison, where there is one prisoner: Grandpa <ja><reading>ごう</reading>いち</ja>.

Note: For the <ja>ごう</ja> reading mnemonics, we use Grandpa <ja>ごういち</ja> because <ja>こういち</ja> is used for the <ja>こう</ja> reading. So just remember that <ja>ごう</ja> comes from Koichi's grandpa <ja>ごういち</ja>.
readingInfo: Grandpa <ja>ごういち</ja> keeps saying numbers as you free him from the prison. Just one after another. Numbers numbers numbers. Hopefully old man <ja>ごういち</ja> isn't crazy.
